master.comparisonNetworkCoverage: \{comparisonChapter1Topic1Option2} - No — Search network doctors and facilities
master.comparisonPcpRequirement: \{comparisonChapter1Topic2Option1} - Yes — you'll need to choose a PCP to help provide and coordinate your care
master.planDescription:
With this health plan, you’ll need to select a primary care physician (PCP) from our network. Your PCP will perform a key role in guiding your health care by helping you avoid duplicating tests and services, connecting you with a specialist if needed, and supporting you in achieving your best health. 

 

This plan is designed to help you pay less when you see Tier 1 doctors and specialists. Our Tier 1 providers list is updated annually so it’s important to check your providers Tier 1 status before accessing care. In addition, using freestanding facilities for certain services can help drive cost savings. 

 

There’s no coverage if you use an out-of-network provider and you will be responsible for the cost of care services.  You’ll have a higher coverage if you get an electronic referral from your PCP to see a network specialist and a lower coverage if no referral.   

 

Preventive care is covered 100 percent in the network. By using a network provider, you don't have to pay any out-of-pocket costs for age-appropriate preventive care.
master.planDetailPagePrimaryCarePhysicianTopic1: \{planDetailPagePrimaryCarePhysicianTopic1Option1} - With this plan, you'll need to select a primary care physician (PCP)
master.summaryCopays: \{summaryTopic3Option1} - Copay due for certain services, prescriptions and locations
master.summaryNetworkCoverage: \{summaryTopic1Option3} - Only network providers covered, including Tier 1 providers
